meanings.definition: To perform official duties or functions
meanings.sent1: She will officiate the meeting tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The judge will officiate the swearing-in ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to officiate the daily feeding time.
meanings.sent4: His presence seemed to officiate the room with authority.
meanings.sent5: The principal's officiating of the school assembly was impressive.

meanings.definition: To act as an official in a ceremony or event
meanings.sent1: He officiated at his sister's wedding.
meanings.sent2: The priest will officiate at the baptism.
meanings.sent3: The penguin wanted to officiate the fish-catching competition.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to officiate the joy of the occasion.
meanings.sent5: The mayor's officiating of the parade brought a sense of pride to the town.
